summary: Krishna is a very important god in Hinduism. He is considered the eighth avatar (reincarnation) of Vishnu and is sometimes seen as the supreme god. Krishna is known for his love, compassion, and protection. His birthday, Krishna Janmashtami, is celebrated every year in late August or early September. Stories about his life are called Krishna Līlā and are found in many Hindu texts. He is shown in different forms, like a baby eating butter or a charioteer in the Bhagavad Gita. People have worshipped Krishna for a long time, and his popularity has spread worldwide, especially through the International Society for Krishna Consciousness (ISKCON).
title: Krishna
